p: For the challenge, 51 rainbow trout per groups (17 fish/aquarium) were anesthetised with MS222 (as described above), and injected intraperitoneally (i.p.) with 6.8 Ã— 10 6 cfu/mL of Y. ruckeri in PBS (0.1 mL/fish). The density of the bacteria was determined according to the previously calculated LD50 value for the rainbow trout juveniles. Dead fish were recorded daily and the fish were taken from the aquarium for 20 days. The bacterium was re-isolated from the dead fish.
